name: lsh
description: Command line interface for managing resources

subcommands.description: Commands to manage API keys for authentication
subcommands.name: lsh api_keys
lsh api_keys create
subcommands.description: Create a new API Key that is tied to the current user account. The created API key is only listed ONCE upon creation. It can however be regenerated or deleted.
Create a new API Key that is tied to the current user account. The created API key is only listed once upon creation. It can however be regenerated or deleted.

options.description: do not send the request to server

subcommands.description: Delete an existing API Key. Once deleted, the API Key can no longer be used to access the API.

subcommands.description: Returns a list of all API keys from the team members.

subcommands.description: login will create a configuration file and save your API authentication token in it, allowing it to be used when interacting with the API. The configuration will be stored in your home directory and also copied to root's directory so sudo commands work seamlessly.

subcommands.name: lsh servers
subcommands.description: Commands to create, list, update and delete servers

subcommands.name: lsh servers create
subcommands.description: Deploy a bare metal server

options.description: Base path for API requests. For example: /
The server billing type. Accepts 'hourly', 'monthly' or 'yearly'.
Do not send the request to server
URL where iPXE script is stored on, necessary for custom image deployments. This attribute is required when iPXE is selected as operating system.

[Required] Enum: ["ipxe","windows_server_2019_std_v1","ubuntu_22_04_x64_lts","debian_11","rockylinux_8","debian_10","rhel8","centos_7_4_x64","centos_8_x64","ubuntu_20_04_x64_lts","debian_12","ubuntu22_ml_in_a_box","windows2022"]. The operating system for the new server

[Required] Enum: ["c2-large-x86","c2-medium-x86","c2-small-x86","c3-large-x86","c3-medium-x86","c3-small-x86","c3-xlarge-x86","g3-large-x86","g3-medium-x86","g3-small-x86","g3-xlarge-x86","m3-large-x86","s2-small-x86","s3-large-x86"]. The plan to choose server from
[Required] The project (ID or Slug) to deploy the server
RAID mode for the server. Enum: ["raid-0","raid-1"]
Choose scheme for requests. Choose from: [https]
[Required] Enum: ["ASH","BGT","BUE","CHI","DAL","FRA","LAX","LON","MEX","MEX2","MIA","MIA2","NYC","SAN","SAN2","SAO","SAO2","SYD","TYO","TYO2"]. The site to deploy the server

subcommands.name: lsh volume mount
subcommands.description: Mount a volume storage to a server. This command will: 1. Auto-fetch volume storage details (including connector_id) 2. Auto-detect the server's NQN from /etc/nvme/hostnqn (or generate a new one if the file doesn't exist) 3. Send the client NQN to the API to authorize access 4. Execute all NVMe-oF connection steps automatically

options.description: Do not send the request to server
[Required] The ID of the volume storage to mount
